tag_list: aim, aol, instant-messaging, jeremy-rephlo, rephlo, im
overview:
Jeremy is an entrepreneur with a background in product management and engineering.

Currently, he is Founder and CEO of Soaked in Pixels, a stealth startup.

Previously, as a member of AOL’s AIM team, Jeremy held various product, people management, and engineering roles growing the AIM user base to tens of millions of people sending billions of messages a day.

In his role as a Director of Product Management for AIM he spearheaded efforts which brought Facebook Chat and Google Chat interoperability to the service allowing AIM users to address the hundreds of millions of users on Facebook and Gmail.

Starting his career as an engineer, he was a co-inventor of an early (2005) location-based system to allow users to identify and chat with users in nearby physical proximity to them. He also improved and maintained the core software that powers the host back end of the AOL Instant Messenger (AIM) service.

Jeremy received two undergraduate degrees from Virginia Tech, a B.S. in Computer Engineering and a B.A. in Economics. He currently lives in Washington, D.C.
